comment: Express the predicate: The limit of complex number sequence ` F ` is ` A ` , or ` F ` converges to ` A ` . This means that for any real ` x ` , no matter how small, there always exists an integer ` j ` such that the absolute difference of any later complex number in the sequence and the limit is less than ` x ` . (Contributed by NM, 28-Aug-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
